name: Get image
body: # get_image WordPress - make it easy ## -How to use - First include this -func_get_image.php- to your project. In your php code just type ### get_image(); *** For more options : get_image(array( 'value' => '', // URL | Object 'system' => '', // Redux | Field | Url 'default_src' => '', // the src link to the default image [ 3 conditional : 1 - link | 2 - null | 3 - name.file ] 'alt' => '', // string or null - if null the input get the name of the image 'default_alt' => '', // this is will be the alt of this image if the real one no exist or not found in the image 'class' => '', // string - adding this string to class in tag 'link' => '', // if link is not empty the tag will have tag wrapper. 'link_id' => '', // ID of the link tag [ < a id ='' /> ] that wrap the image tag. 'link_title' => '', // this is will be the title of your additional link. 'link_class' => '', // string - adding this string to class in tag 'link_target' => '', // can get _blank | _self | _parent | _top 'errorMsg' => 'false', // error message trigger ));
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
